import org.openqa.selenium.By;
import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
import org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver;
import static org.junit.Assert.*;

public class Home_GetStarted {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		//ChromeDriver
		System.setProperty("webdriver.chrome.driver","C:\\Windows\\chromedriver.exe");
		WebDriver driver=new ChromeDriver();
		//Open ShootProof.com
		driver.get("http://shootproof.com");
		
		//Part 1
		//Locate the topmost "Get Started" button on the page
		//Click the button
			//Click Top Get Started button object "using xpath"
				driver.findElement(By.xpath("//*[@id=\"navbar-button-trigger\"]/a[1]")).click();
		//Explain why you chose the language and framework that you did
			//Selenium automated testing is the most used format for automated testing.  It scales quickly and can be coded
				//in many different languages. You can use selenium on its own or incorporate with tools like SauceLabs and Jenkins.
		//If the code and approach is not obvious, describe the approach and decisions made		
		
		
		//Part 2
		//Assert that a "Get Started" button exists at the bottom of the page
				String buttonText = driver.findElement(By.xpath("//*[@id=\"try-free\"]/div/p[2]/a")).getText();
			    Assert.assertTrue("Get Started".equals(buttonText), "Get Started text is found" );				
		//Click the button
			    driver.findElement(By.xpath("//*[@id=\"try-free\"]/div/p[2]/a")).click();
		//Explain why you chose the language and framework that you did (if different from part one)
			    //Same as above
		//If the code and approach is not obvious, describe the approach and decisions made				
				

		//Bottom Get Started button object "using xpath"			
		if(driver.findElements(By.xpath("//*[@id=\"try-free\"]/div/p[2]/a")).size() != 0) {
			System.out.println("Bottom Get Started button is found");
		}else {
			System.out.println("Bottom Get Started button not found");
		}

	}

}
